short_summary: Firing Range Bullet Trap Commercial Rubber Sheet
description: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) requires Firing Range Bullet Trap Commercial rubber sheet to be replaced as material wears out from shooting training. RCMP Depot requires rubber membrane material to be supplied and delivered to site. All the deliverables must be received on or before May 30,2024 This procurement is conditionally set aside under the federal government Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business. In order to be considered, the Bidder must certify that it qualifies as an Indigenous business as defined under PSIB and that it will comply with all requirements of PSIB.if bids from two (2) or more Indigenous businesses are compliant with the terms of the Request for Proposal, the contracting authority will limit the competition to those Indigenous businesses and will not consider bids from any non-Indigenous businesses that may have been submitted.and must meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria to be declared responsive. The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award of a contract.

full_summary:
### Firing Range Bullet Trap Commercial Rubber Sheet - Request for Proposal

**Tender No.** : M5000-24-4084/A  
**Tender Date** : February 13, 2024  
**Closing Date** : March 05, 2024, at 15:00:00  
**Expected Contract Start Date** : May 30, 2024  

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the supply and delivery of Firing Range Bullet Trap Commercial Rubber Sheets.

**Procurement Description**
The RCMP requires a commercial rubber sheet to replace existing material worn out from shooting training at the RCMP Depot. The supply of rubber membrane material must be delivered on or before May 30, 2024. This procurement is conditionally set aside under the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business.

**Required Documents**

- Request for Proposal (RFP)  M5000-24-4084A (English)
- Amendment of RFP (English and French)
- RFP (French)
- Amendment of RFP (English and French)

**Contact Information**
For further information, please contact:

Shailesh Rajgor  
Procurement and Contracting Services, RCMP  

Email: [shaileshkumar.rajgor@rcmp-grc.gc.ca](mailto:shaileshkumar.rajgor@rcmp-grc.gc.ca)  
Phone: (780) 670-8554  
Address: 10065 - Jasper Avenue, 5th Floor, Edmonton, Alberta. T5J 3B1

**Evaluation Criteria**
A bid must comply with the requirements of the bid solicitation and meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria to be declared responsive. The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award of a contract.

**Trade Agreements**
This procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Attachment**
The attachment of this RFP includes the tender documents in PDF format for easy access.

Please refer to the attached tender documents for more information on the procurement. You can also download the RFP and amendment documents via the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) website at [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/fr/offres-dappels-doffres](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/fr/offres-dappels-doffres).

Note: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police is an equal opportunities employer and encourages bids from Indigenous businesses. The Indigenous
